boardgame.name: Goool!
Mano a Mano
Street Soccer
StreetSoccer
boardgame.description: StreetSoccer is the name in the Netherlands (Dutch: Straatvoetbal) for how soccer is played in parks or squares in cities and villages._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In this game 2 StreetSoccer teams play a 25 'minute' match. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The soccer field is 10 spaces long and 6 wide (plus spaces outside the lines)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 2 players of this game both are coaches of one team. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Both coaches have 5 StreetSoccer player figures (incl. the goalie). _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A die determines your number of spaces to move one of your figures. If you reach the ball you shoot the ball by the unused number of pips on the die plus one, and can make passes between players of your team. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The die makes luck a part of this game. But your choices, like which player you move to which field and where to pass the ball are very important. For the following turns you calculate chances for your opponent and yourself and you try to have your players in good positions for later situations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2003 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 9: Panamax, They Live, and Solforge

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

never played +++++ english, german, french and netherlands rules are included and the game part are completely language independent +++++ shipping with insurance only +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia or australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for other non-euro-currency countries in europe : paypal, cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : cash (by letter) or bank transfer (wich by the way is cost-free !) +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ foreign buyers beware : german postal sadly is very expensive for foreign packages (about 18 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped and the weight), pleask at for shipping prices, before you buy !) +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros, including insurance
